issue.title: [Feedback] Network Console will be removed in Edge 143
issue.body:
Starting with Edge 143, the Network Console tool will be removed from Edge DevTools with no replacement. As our team shifts focus toward delivering more stable features and improving alignment with Chrome, we no longer have the capacity to maintain this tool. We recommend using the REST Client extension for VS Code for API development and testing.

If this feature is important to your workflow, we encourage you to share your feedback. Strong interest could help motivate bringing it to Chromium in the future.

comment.body:
Cut the corporate fluff—killing Network Console is nothing but laziness wrapped in a “Chrome-aligned” excuse. You literally ripped out the only zero-friction way to replay, tweak, and eyeball requests without leaving the browser, then punted us to a VS Code extension like it’s 1995 and context-switching is free.

If the maintenance budget is too precious, open-source the damn panel and let the community carry it. Afraid to show how thin the wrapper really is? Thought so.

“Strong feedback might resurrect it upstream” is insulting gaslighting. Chromium’s graveyard is littered with tickets older than some of your interns. Ship a polyfill, restore the panel, or admit Edge DevTools is just a reskinned Chrome with extra telemetry—then watch power-users stampede back to the real thing.

Clock’s ticking.

commits.message: Added schema validation and error throw from controller

review.body:
This is a great idea! . It will give better error messages in case the user has a typo in their configuration. The code and test look solid. The only thing that's left is notifying the users about this addition in the changelog. 

To add a changelog entry, you can simply add a file (aka *news fragment*) to `changelog.d/` stating that incorrect configuration values for *default_fixture_loop_scope* and *default_test_loop_scope* now give a better error message. The news fragment should point to the underlying issue or, in this case, the PR and should have the category *added*. That means the complete file path for the news item is `changelog.d/1189.added.rst`.

I'd also appreciate if you could squash the commits in this PR (just this once), so we don't have the fixup commits from pre-commit CI in the Git history.

pull_request.title: Fix: Add validation for `asyncio_default_fixture_loop_scope`
pull_request.body:
This PR addresses an issue where the `asyncio_default_fixture_loop_scope` configuration option in `pytest.ini` was not being validated. This could lead to misconfigurations and unexpected behavior without providing any feedback to the user.

This change introduces a validation check in `pytest_asyncio/plugin.py` to ensure that the provided scope is one of the valid options (`function`, `class`, `module`, `package`, or `session`). If an invalid scope is provided, a `pytest.UsageError` is raised with a descriptive error message.

Additionally, a new test case has been added to `tests/test_fixture_loop_scopes.py` to verify that an invalid scope configuration correctly raises an error.

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Issues that enhances existing functionality, or adds new features

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description:
Issues we want to address, but are either not sure when we want to do them, or have not been able to get them done in time for a release go here.

Issues from here may be triaged back into fixed milestones once we have a better idea of when we can get them completed.

issue.body: In Chocolatey GUI, we show Chocolatey's ouput in a progress dialog when you're performing an operation on a package. Previously, we implemented our own powershell shell and redirected it, and it worked pretty well. Now, with the API, Choco does this and we implement ILog to intercept this information which is a little hacky and doesn't give us access to progress notifications. Would be awesome to have an independent thing we can plug into to pipe package output and progress as well as receive package errors and such.

comment.body: Thanks for raising this issue. After reviewing it, it's not something we expect to prioritise in the foreseeable future. We’re closing it to keep our backlog focused, but we’re open to revisiting it in the future if priorities shift or new interest arises. You are welcome to comment here or open a new issue if you'd like to discuss it further down the line.

comment.body:
_⚠️ Potential issue_

**Fix invalidateQueries usage to target the correct query key.**

invalidateQueries expects a QueryKey or filters, not full query options. Passing queryOptions directly will cause a type mismatch and won’t invalidate as intended.

Apply this diff:

```diff
-            onSuccess: () => {
+            onSuccess: () => {
                 form.reset()
-                queryClient.invalidateQueries(
-                    trpc.messages.getMany.queryOptions({ projectId })
-                )
+                queryClient.invalidateQueries(
+                    trpc.messages.getMany.queryOptions({ projectId }).queryKey
+                )
                 // TODO: Invalidate usage status
             },
```
Alternatively, if available in your proxy: queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: trpc.messages.getMany.getQueryKey({ projectId }) }).

issue.title: [API] Add official API for piping package install/uninstall output and progress indicators

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Issues that enhances existing functionality, or adds new features

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description:
Issues we want to address, but are either not sure when we want to do them, or have not been able to get them done in time for a release go here.

Issues from here may be triaged back into fixed milestones once we have a better idea of when we can get them completed.

issue.body: In Chocolatey GUI, we show Chocolatey's ouput in a progress dialog when you're performing an operation on a package. Previously, we implemented our own powershell shell and redirected it, and it worked pretty well. Now, with the API, Choco does this and we implement ILog to intercept this information which is a little hacky and doesn't give us access to progress notifications. Would be awesome to have an independent thing we can plug into to pipe package output and progress as well as receive package errors and such.

+

Wrapping MessagesContainer with an error boundary gives users a graceful fallback on failures. }> Loading messages...

`7-27`: **Paginate and index for scalability** Fetching all messages for a project will not scale. Add cursor/limit pagination and a composite index on (projectId, updatedAt) in Prisma for efficient ordered reads. Proposed API sketch: ```ts .input(z.object({ projectId: z.string().min(1), cursor: z.string().uuid().optional(), limit: z.number().min(1).max(100).default(50), })) .query(async ({ input }) => { const items = await prisma.message.findMany({ where: { projectId: input.projectId }, orderBy: { updatedAt: 'asc' }, take: input.limit, ...(input.cursor ? { cursor: { id: input.cursor }, skip: 1 } : {}), include: { fragment: true }, }) const nextCursor = items.length === input.limit ? items[items.length - 1].id : undefined return { items, nextCursor } }) ``` Also ensure an index like: ```prisma @@index([projectId, updatedAt]) ```

Apply this diff: ```diff - useEffect(() => { - bottomRef.current?.scrollIntoView() - }, [messages.length]) + useEffect(() => { + bottomRef.current?.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth', block: 'end' }) + }, [messages.length]) ``` --- `37-49`: **Consider virtualization for long message lists** Mapping all messages will degrade performance as the list grows. comment.body:
![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)

這個新的 `handleSend` 函式很好地封裝了與 Gemini API 的互動邏輯。不過，在 `failure` case 中，建議在呼叫 `onError` 顯示錯誤訊息給用戶後，保留輸入框中的文字，而不是立即清空 `newTodoText` 並關閉輸入模式。這樣用戶就可以在修正可能的輸入錯誤（例如錯字）後，無需重新輸入整個句子，直接再次嘗試發送，從而改善用戶體驗。

comment.body:
![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)

在 `onDisappear` 中使用 `NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self)` 會移除此物件註冊的**所有**通知。雖然方便，但這是一個比較有風險的做法，可能會意外地移除不應被移除的觀察者，尤其當視圖變得更複雜時。

**建議：**
為了提高程式碼的健壯性，建議明確地移除您在 `setupDataChangeObservers` 中註冊的每一個觀察者，確保只移除了您自己添加的觀察者，避免產生非預期的副作用。

```swift
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("iCloudUserChanged"), object: nil)
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("TodoItemStatusChanged"), object: nil)
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("TodoItemsDataRefreshed"), object: nil)
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("CompletedDaysDataChanged"), object: nil)
```

MAINT: run `yamllint` on pre-commit configuration

Use `yamllint` default parameters.

MAINT: Update pre-commit configuration

Monthly updates.

MAINT: Stop running pre-commit as a GitHub Action

Try pre-commit.ci instead.

Merge pull request #1503 from DimitriPapadopoulos/pre-commit_yaml

MAINT: Update pre-commit configuration

MAINT: Remove obsolete setuptools-specific configuration

* `platforms`
  Sets the `Platform` core-metadata: A Platform specification describing
  an operating system supported by the distribution which is not listed
  in the "Operating System" Trove classifiers. Its use with "any" is not
  documented anywhere, and seems redundant with the existing classifier
  which is currently displayed by PyPI:
    Operating System :: OS Independent
* `zip-safe`
  Documenetd as obsolete.
* `include-package-data`
  True by default.

https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/userguide/pyproject_config.html#setuptools-specific-configuration
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34994130/what-does-the-platforms-argument-to-setup-in-setup-py-do

MAINT: Start by defining `build-system`

This is usually the first table, followed by `project` and `tool`.

https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/guides/writing-pyproject-toml/

MAINT: exclude more files from packaging

Add files to be excluded to MANIFEST.in to remove them from sdist and bdist.

+        }
+        if rawValue.starts(with: "$(") {
+            print("❌ 設定錯誤：Key '\(key)' 的值 '\(rawValue)' 沒有被 .xcconfig 正確替換。請檢查 Build Settings 中的連結。")
+            return nil
+        }
+        return rawValue.trimmingCharacters(in: .whitespacesAndNewlines).trimmingCharacters(in: CharacterSet(charactersIn: "\""))
+    }
+}
+
+
+// MARK: - Gemini API Response Handling
+/// ✨✨✨ 修改 #1: 改造 GeminiResponse，使其成為專用的解析與轉換器 ✨✨✨
+/// 這個結構現在只負責一件事：將 API 回傳的 JSON，轉換成 App 標準的 `[TodoItem]` 格式。
+struct GeminiResponse: Decodable {
+    
+    /// 提供一個計算屬性，直接將解碼後的資料轉換成 `[TodoItem]`。這是此結構最主要的功能。
+    var asTodoItems: [TodoItem] {
+        return geminiTasks.map { geminiTask -> TodoItem in
+            let dateFormatter = DateFormatter()
+            dateFormatter.dateFormat = "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm"
+            dateFormatter.locale = Locale(identifier: "en_US_POSIX")
+            
+            var finalDate: Date? = nil
+            if let dateString = geminiTask.date {
+                let timeString = (geminiTask.time?.isEmpty ?? true) ? "00:00" : geminiTask.time!
+                finalDate = dateFormatter.date(from: "\(dateString) \(timeString)")
+            }
+
+            // 使用您在 `TodoItem.swift` 中定義的結構來建立新物件
+            return TodoItem(
+                id: UUID(),
+                userID: "user123", // TODO: 請根據您的登入系統填入實際的用戶 ID
+                title: geminiTask.title,
+                priority: 0,
+                isPinned: false,
+                taskDate: finalDate,
+                note: geminiTask.notes ?? "",
+                status: .toBeStarted,
+                createdAt: Date(),
+                updatedAt: Date(),
+                correspondingImageID: ""
+            )
+        }
+    }
+    
+    // --- 內部實作細節 ---
+    private struct GeminiTask: Decodable {
+        let title: String
+        let notes: String?
+        let date: String?
+        let time: String?
+    }
+    
+    private let geminiTasks: [GeminiTask]
+    
+    init(from decoder: Decoder) throws {
+        let container = try decoder.container(keyedBy: CodingKeys.self)
+        self.geminiTasks = try container.decode([GeminiTask].self, forKey: .tasks)
+    }
+    
+    private enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
+        case tasks
+    }
+}
+
+
+// MARK: - Gemini Service Class
+class GeminiService: ObservableObject {
+    
+    private let apiKey = AppSecrets.apiKey
+    private let apiURL = AppSecrets.apiURL
+
+    /// ✨✨✨ 修改 #2: 簡化 `analyzeText` 函式，讓它直接回傳 `[TodoItem]` ✨✨✨
+    /// 分析使用者輸入的文字，並回傳標準的 `[TodoItem]` 陣列。
+    /// - Parameters:
+    ///   - text: 使用者輸入的文字。
+    ///   - completion: 完成時的回調，回傳 `Result<[TodoItem], Error>`。
+    func analyzeText(_ text: String, completion: @escaping (Result<[TodoItem], Error>) -> Void) {
+        
+        var request = URLRequest(url: apiURL)
+        request.httpMethod = "POST"
+        request.addValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Content-Type")
+        request.addValue(apiKey, forHTTPHeaderField: "x-goog-api-key")
+        
+        let formatter = DateFormatter()
+        formatter.dateStyle = .long
+        formatter.timeStyle = .short
+        let currentDateString = formatter.string(from: Date())
+        
+        let prompt = """
+        Analyze the following text which contains one or more tasks. Today's date is \(currentDateString).
+        Extract the title, notes, date, and time for each task.
+        The "title" should only be the core action (e.g., "開會", "買東西").
+        Information about "with whom" or "where" should be included in the "notes".
+        The date should be in "YYYY-MM-DD" format.
+        The time should be in "HH:mm" format (24-hour).
+        If any field is not mentioned, return it as null.
+        
+        Your response MUST be a valid JSON object that only contains a key "tasks" which is an array of task objects. Do not include any other text or markdown formatting.
+        
+        Example 1:
+        Text: "提醒我明天下午三點跟John在會議室開會，然後下週五要去工學院C317交報告"
+        Response:
+        {
+          "tasks": [
+            { "title": "開會", "notes": "跟John在會議室", "date": "2025-08-15", "time": "15:00" },
+            { "title": "交報告", "notes": "去工學院C317", "date": "2025-08-22", "time": null }
+          ]
+        }
+        
+        Now, analyze this text: "\(text)"
+        """
+        
+        let requestBody: [String: Any] = [
+            "contents": [["parts": [["text": prompt]]]],
+            "generationConfig": ["responseMimeType": "application/json"]
+        ]
+        
+        guard let httpBody = try? JSONSerialization.data(withJSONObject: requestBody) else {
+            completion(.failure(NSError(domain: "GeminiService", code: 1, userInfo: [NSLocalizedDescriptionKey: "Failed to serialize request body"])))
+            return
+        }
+        
+        request.httpBody = httpBody
+        
+        URLSession.shared.dataTask(with: request) { data, response, error in
+            if let error = error {
+                DispatchQueue.main.async { completion(.failure(error)) }
+                return
+            }
+            
+            guard let data = data else {
+                DispatchQueue.main.async { completion(.failure(NSError(domain: "GeminiService", code: 2, userInfo: [NSLocalizedDescriptionKey: "No data received"]))) }
+                return
+            }
+            
+            // 解析 Gemini API 的回傳內容
+            do {
+                if let jsonObject = try JSONSerialization.jsonObject(with: data) as? [String: Any],
+                   let candidates = jsonObject["candidates"] as? [[String: Any]],
+                   let firstCandidate = candidates.first,
+                   let content = firstCandidate["content"] as? [String: Any],
+                   let parts = content["parts"] as? [[String: Any]],
+                   let firstPart = parts.first,
+                   let textData = firstPart["text"] as? String {

comment.body:
![critical](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/critical.svg)

檢測到 `GEMINI_API_KEY` 被直接硬編碼在 `Keys.xcconfig` 檔案中。將 API 金鑰等敏感資訊提交到版本控制系統（如 Git）是一個**嚴重的安全風險**。惡意行為者可以掃描公開的程式碼庫來尋找這類金鑰，並濫用您的服務，可能導致非預期的費用或服務中斷。

**強烈建議：**
1.  **立即**從此檔案中移除 API 金鑰，並在您的 Google Cloud Console 中**輪換 (rotate)** 此金鑰，使其失效。
2.  將 `Keys.xcconfig` 加入到您的 `.gitignore` 檔案中，以防止它未來被意外提交。
3.  建立一個 `Keys.xcconfig.template` 或在 README 中說明，指導其他開發者如何建立自己的 `Keys.xcconfig` 檔案並填入他們自己的金鑰以進行本地開發。

```
// 請將此檔案加入 .gitignore，並從您的 Git 歷史紀錄中移除此金鑰。
// 範本：GEMINI_API_KEY = "YOUR_API_KEY_HERE"
```

comment.body:
![high](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/high-priority.svg)

`GeminiApiUrl` 的值 ` $(GEMINI_API_URL)` 前方有一個多餘的空格。雖然 `AppSecrets` 中的程式碼會修剪空白字元，但最好在源頭就保持資料的乾淨，以避免未來潛在的錯誤或混淆。如果其他地方直接讀取此值而未經處理，可能會導致 URL 解析失敗。

```
	<string>$(GEMINI_API_URL)</string>
```

review.body:
## Code Review

這次的提交包含了大規模的重構，做得很好！特別是將狀態從 `HomeBottomView` 提升到 `Home`，並引入了由 Gemini 驅動、帶有確認步驟（`TaskSelectionOverlay`）的新任務創建流程，這大大改善了狀態管理和用戶體驗。`ErrorToastView` 的加入也為錯誤處理提供了更清晰的用戶反饋。

我留下了一條關於 `Keys.xcconfig` 中硬編碼 API 金鑰的**嚴重**級別評論，這出於安全考量必須立即處理。此外，我也指出了幾個中等級別的問題，涉及硬編碼的用戶 ID、JSON 解析的簡化機會，以及日誌記錄和程式碼健壯性的提升空間。

另外，新程式碼中散佈了許多 `print` 語句（例如在 `Home.swift`、`GeminiService.swift` 中）。雖然這在調試時很有用，但在合併到主分支前應將其移除或替換為正式的日誌框架，以保持控制台輸出的整潔。

commits.message: feat: update database configuration to use PostgreSQL, enhance error handling in dues API, and improve data fetching logic

Enhance SSE connection tests with improved cleanup and error handling

This commit updates the Server-Sent Events (SSE) connection tests to improve cleanup procedures and error handling. Key changes include:

- Removed unnecessary loop variable capture in tests, aligning with Go 1.22+ standards.
- Updated HTTP request creation to use `http.NoBody` for clarity and consistency.
- Added helper function markers to improve test stack trace readability.
- Enhanced response body closure handling to ignore errors during testing.
- Refined assertions to use `require.Positive` for better clarity in connection success checks.

These improvements enhance the reliability and maintainability of the SSE connection tests, ensuring robust error handling and cleanup processes.

commits.message:
feat: Display orphaned stopwatch modes in history

Show modes that exist in tracking logs but not in stopwatch_modes.conf
at the end of the history display with default styling (no icon, default
background). This ensures tracked time is never lost even if modes are
removed from config.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

refactor: Move stopwatch logs to ~/personal/tracking/logs/

Change tracking directory from ~/personal/tracking/ to ~/personal/tracking/logs/
for better organization of tracking data.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

fix: Reset stopwatch history to today on sketchybar reload

Clear the history date file when sketchybar reloads to ensure the history
view always starts with today's data instead of persisting the last viewed date.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

big-refactor(sketchybar:stopwatch): Simplify stopwatch to use sketchybar updates instead of background processes

Major simplification of the stopwatch system:
- Eliminated background processes using sketchybar's update_freq mechanism
- Integrated mode rendering and cycling into main stopwatch.sh
- Removed redundant scripts (render_stopwatch_modes.sh, stopwatch_toggle_mode.sh)
- Added smooth mode highlighting updates without re-rendering
- Updated Hammerspoon keybindings to work with new system

Changes:
- No more PID tracking or orphaned processes
- Dynamic update frequency (1Hz when running, 0Hz when stopped)
- ~60% code reduction (from 7+ scripts to 2)
- Alt+M now smoothly cycles modes without visual flicker

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

fix: Restore stopwatch appearance when reloading sketchybar with timer running

When sketchybar reloads while a timer is running, properly restore:
- Mode icon and colors
- Background color based on current mode
- Correct text color (black on yellow, white on others)

This ensures the timer continues seamlessly after reload with full visual state.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

fix: Update toggle_center_view to use START_FILE and prevent Spotify flash

- Replace PID_FILE check with START_FILE for stopwatch state detection
- Fix bash command syntax for render_modes call
- Set Spotify items to start hidden to prevent reload flash

This ensures proper view toggling while timer is running and eliminates
visual artifacts during sketchybar reload.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

refactor: Simplify stopwatch system and move config to personal/tracking

- Remove redundant mode/label separation in config (now just mode|icon|color)
- Simplify log format to start_time|end_time|mode (calculate duration when needed)
- Move stopwatch_modes.conf to ~/personal/tracking/ for centralized tracking
- Reduce stopwatch_history.sh from 218 to 199 lines using helper functions
- Update all file references to new config location

🤖 Generated with Claude Code

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

fix: Replace hardcoded mode defaults with dynamic config reading

- Add get_default_mode() function to read first mode from config
  - Remove all hardcoded "OSE", "work", "ose" defaults
  - Fix remaining 4-field reads to use 3-field config format
  - Ensure default mode changes automatically when config is reordered

refactor: Unify color mapping logic and remove hardcoded defaults

- Add centralized color mapping functions (map_color_to_hex, get_text_color_for_background)
- Remove duplicate color logic between idle and active states
- Replace hardcoded 'OSE' defaults with dynamic get_default_mode() function
- Fix stopwatch config to read first mode from config file as default
- Simplify text color determination for all backgrounds

🤖 Generated with Claude Code

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
